meanings.definition: To cool (a liquid) below its freezing point without solidification.
meanings.sent1: I tried to subcool the water to make it extra cold for the party.
meanings.sent2: The scientist was able to subcool the liquid to a temperature below freezing.
meanings.sent3: The chef accidentally subcooled the soup, turning it into a slushy mess.
meanings.sent4: She subcooled her drink so much that it felt like drinking liquid ice.
meanings.sent5: The magician's trick was to subcool the water instantly, impressing the audience.

meanings.definition: To cool (a vapor) below its boiling point without condensation.
meanings.sent1: The air conditioning unit was able to subcool the vapor, creating a refreshing breeze.
meanings.sent2: The engineer developed a method to subcool the vapor without causing any leaks.
meanings.sent3: The weather was so hot that even the clouds seemed to subcool in the sky.
meanings.sent4: Her calm demeanor seemed to subcool the tense atmosphere in the room.
meanings.sent5: The cool breeze subcooled the steam rising from the cup of tea, creating a mystical effect.
